intro: Byttneria longicuspis, commonly known as the long-spined bignonia, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
